ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: For many times, we are not just aligning plots as what 'cowplot' and 'patchwork' did. Users would like to align associated information that requires axes to be exactly matched in subplots, e.g. hierarchical clustering with a heatmap. This package provides utilities to aligns associated subplots to a main plot at different sides (left, right, top and bottom) with axes exactly matched.

For many times, we are not just aligning plots as what 'cowplot' and 'patchwork' did. Users would like to align associated information that requires axes to be exactly matched in subplots, e.g. hierarchical clustering with a heatmap. This package provides utilities to aligns associated subplots to a main plot at different sides (left, right, top and bottom) with axes exactly matched.

name: r-aplot
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.2.9" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-aplot
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/aplot_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/aplot/aplot_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ab0c78b25319324bc9bdbdcd7c165c0f040767c8eccca059571008128af3e57b

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggfun >=0.0.4
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggplotify
    - r-magrittr
    - r-patchwork
    - r-yulab.utils
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggfun >=0.0.4
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggplotify
    - r-magrittr
    - r-patchwork
    - r-yulab.utils

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('aplot')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('aplot')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/YuLab-SMU/aplot
  license: Artistic-2.0
  summary: For many times, we are not just aligning plots as what 'cowplot' and 'patchwork' did. Users would like to align associated information that requires axes to be exactly matched in subplots, e.g. hierarchical clustering with a heatmap. This package provides utilities to aligns associated subplots to a main plot
    at different sides (left, right, top and bottom) with axes exactly matched.
  license_family: OTHER
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/Artistic-2.0

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: aplot
# Title: Decorate a 'ggplot' with Associated Information
# Version: 0.0.4
# Authors@R: person("Guangchuang", "Yu", email = "guangchuangyu@gmail.com", role = c("aut", "cre", "cph"), comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-6485-8781"))
# Description: For many times, we are not just aligning plots as what 'cowplot' and 'patchwork' did. Users would like to align associated information that requires axes to be exactly matched in subplots, e.g. hierarchical clustering with a heatmap. This package provides utilities to aligns associated subplots to a main plot at different sides (left, right, top and bottom) with axes exactly matched.
# Imports: ggplot2, patchwork, magrittr, methods
# Suggests: rvcheck, ggtree
# URL: https://github.com/YuLab-SMU/aplot
# License: Artistic-2.0
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.0.2
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2020-04-07 09:18:07 UTC; ygc
# Author: Guangchuang Yu [aut, cre, cph] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6485-8781>)
# Maintainer: Guangchuang Yu <guangchuangyu@gmail.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-04-07 09:40:03 UTC
